tests.test_model_data_base.context module¶

tests.test_model_data_base.dask_test module¶

class tests.test_model_data_base.dask_test.Test(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

test_join_operation_of_dask()[source]¶

Tests the join operation of dask. Should be ok if dask >= 0.10.2 Compare https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38416836/result-of-join-in-dask-dataframes-seems-to-depend-on-the-way-the-dask-datafram

tests.test_model_data_base.dask_test.get_ddf()[source]¶

constructs dask dataframe out of pandas dataframes via the .from-delayed method with indexes A1, A2, A3, … F3, F3, F4

tests.test_model_data_base.dask_test.get_pdf(character)[source]¶

constructs a pandas dataframe with indexes [character]1, …, [character]5

tests.test_model_data_base.decorators module¶

tests.test_model_data_base.decorators.testlevel(flag)[source]¶

decorator for test functions using to define testlevels. This allows to run timeconsuming tests only if necessary.

Recommended usage: testlevel 0: very quick testlevel 1: takes a while testlevel 2: heavy computations
